definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The possible upconversion mechanism is also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 並討論了鉺離子上轉換髮光機制。

sentences.english: Ternary tungsten-tellurite glass system was researched in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 研究了摻鉺鎢碲酸鹽玻璃的吸收光譜和熒光光譜。

sentences.english: Erbium doped ZnO has been prepared by vapor-phase transport process.
sentences.chinese: 鉺摻雜氧化鋅已經由氣相轉換的過程製備。

sentences.english: A two-stage broadband erbium-doped fiber based amplified spontaneous emission(ASE) source is presented.
sentences.chinese: 報道了一種基於摻鉺光纖的兩級寬帶光源。

sentences.english: Erbium ion-doped tungstentellurite glass was fabricated and characterized by absorption spectrum and fluorescence spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 研究了摻鉺鎢碲酸鹽玻璃的吸收光譜和熒光光譜。

sentences.english: The fish cringed away from the bait when the wan with the fishing rod coughed.
sentences.chinese: 垂釣者咳嗽了一聲，魚兒便嚇得從釣鉺旁遊走了。

sentences.english: The experimental system with two Er-doped fiber ring lasers is constructed.
sentences.chinese: 構建了雙環摻鉺光纖環形激光器的實驗系統。

sentences.english: Then Lim lowered the hook without bait.
sentences.chinese: 於是，林把沒有誘鉺的鉤垂下水去。

sentences.english: Objective To study the application of erbium laser in minimal intervention dentistry.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究鉺激光在最小干預牙科技術中的應用。

sentences.english: Finally, studied the gain flattening methods of the erbium-doped fiber source.
sentences.chinese: 最後研究了摻鉺光纖光源增益平坦化方法。

sentences.english: It is presented that this type of twin-core erbium-doped fiber is well fit for gain equalization.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明，雙芯摻鉺光纖具有良好的增益均衡特性。

sentences.english: Study on spectroscopic properties and thermal stability of novel erbium-doped tellurite glasses;
sentences.chinese: 研究了摻鉺鎢碲酸鹽玻璃的吸收光譜和熒光光譜。

sentences.english: Gain of erbium-doped optical waveguide amplifiers in phosphate glass has been researched.
sentences.chinese: 本文對摻鉺磷酸鹽波導放大器的關鍵技術進行研究。

definition: operculum (Latin: little lid)/a covering flap (in various branches of anatomy)
